The documents state that Saladin was the commander of the forces at the Battle of Hattin.

llama3.1.full_ans:
{'output': 'no'}

The documents mention that Saladin (Salah ad-Din Yusuf) was the leader of the Ayyubid dynasty and a prominent Muslim military commander who led the forces in the Battle of Hattin. However, they do not indicate that Al-Afdal ibn Salah ad-Din was the commander of the battle. In fact, the documents mention Saladin as one of the commanders on the Ayyubid side, along with Gokbori, Al-Muzaffar Umar, and Al-Adil I, among others.

mistral.reason: Al-Afdal ibn Salah ad-Din was a son of Saladin, but he did not command the army at the Battle of Hattin. Instead, the commander of the Ayyubid forces in the battle was Saladin himself.

gemma2.reason: Several provided text passages explicitly state that Saladin was the commander of the Ayyubid forces at the Battle of Hattin.

llama3.1.reason: Al-Afdal ibn Salah ad-Din was the commander of Saladin, but not at the Battle of Hattin.
